alert.note: Alert for Eastern Ulster; Western Greene; Western Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 12:31AM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Ulster and south central Greene Counties through 115 AM EDT... At 1230 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Kenneth L Wilson Campground, or 12 miles south of Hunter, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rains could cause ponding of water. Locations impacted include... Hunter, Woodstock, Woodland Valley Campground, West Hurley, Kenneth L Wilson Campground, Mount Tremper, Lanesville, Phoenicia, North-South Lake Campground, Veteran, Centerville, Tannersville, Ashokan, Quarryville, Glenford, Manorville, Katsbaan, Shultis Corners, Haines Falls and Woodland. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized ponding of water on roads.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Ulster; Western Greene; Western Ulster
